intro: Eleocharis maculosa, commonly known as spikerush, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist environments. The plant has slender, unbranched stems that are often reddish or purplish in color. Its small, spike-like inflorescences contain tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Eleocharis maculosa plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
